# setTextContentType(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the text field’s semantic meaning.

## Declaration

```swift
func setTextContentType(_ textContentType: WKTextContentType?)
```

## Parameters

- **textContentType**: The text field’s content type. Passing `nil` clears the content type. For a list of possible content types, see [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType].

## Discussion

The text field’s content type modifies how the text input controller and Apple Continuity Keyboard behave.

- The input controller provides suggestions for [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/oneTimeCode] content types, when available.
- The input controller displays a number pad for [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/telephoneNumber], [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/creditCardNumber], [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/oneTimeCode], and [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/postalCode] content types.
- The input controller disables dictation for [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/password] and [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKTextContentType/newPassword] content types.
- The Apple Continuity Keyboard autofills data based on the content type. To share login credentials from your web page, set up an associated domain for your watchOS app.

## Specifying the Content Type

- **WKTextContentType**: Constants that specify a text field’s semantic meaning.
